story: Alaa Attya Mohamed shared a link to the group: Egyptian Geeks.
name: Pulling a Large MySQL Table into elasticsearch - 21st Century DevOps
caption: blog.randywallace.com
description: If you need to perform realtime queries against a huge MySQL table, but are no longer able to due to the size of the table, read on to find out how â€¦

data.message:
This trick is used in most big websites. lets say e-commerce.

You save your product in mysql the data get exported to either memcached, Elasticsearch or Solr and you get your data directly from them. You will also find the need to expire keys maybe by using any good MQ systems and running a full import in case of something wrong or running a migration.
Mohamed Alaa El Din I always get into troubles when it comes to importing big data tables either to a caching engine like reddis or memcahed or even with elasticsearch :/
why is that? what kind of troubles?
Mohamed Alaa El Din I got a mysql table with +100000 records needs to be synced to the cache and mysql server got hang up will the cronjob was pulling the data :(
something u are doing wrong. coz i do the same with millions of records and it works. can u show me a flow chart of your process and i will try to help u debugging it.

Mohamed Alaa El Din i got the problem you was right it was my fault. pulling all the table records every time. 
kont dayef field 3shan a3raf beh el record dah synced 3la elasticsearch wla la2. 3aref eih el moshkla :D el field kan wa5ed default value b false le kol el records w fy query tany byupdato b false kol shwya (leeh m3rfsh ana kan f dma3'y eih sa3taha).
:D Good U got it solved Alaa Attya Mohamed (Y) Very well done :) Can u tell me in which app u use it just a general idea.
Mohamed Alaa El Din may be a new startup ;)
